description.narrative: Support Women in Leadership - Strengthen gender sensitization of political institutions, legal and policy frameworks.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Development Fund for Women

activity-description.narrative: Support and empower women in Papua New Guinea to take leadership roles. The project is based in Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: United Nations Development Fund for Women
United Nations Development Fund for Women
United Nations Development Fund for Women
United Nations Development Fund for Women
United Nations Development Fund for Women
United Nations Development Fund for Women

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Project Outcome 1: Legal and policy frameworks and arrangements promote gender balance in political decision-making bodies Output 1.1 Technical assistance provided to Government of Papua New Guinea institutions as required to strengthen women's political leadership, especially at national level. Indicator: Types and number of activities delivered, including coordination activities (PW)
Project Outcome 2: A cadre of interested, diverse and capable women political leaders is formed at national and sub-national levels. Output 2.1 Action research undertaken to track progress for women over time in the target provinces. Indicator: 1. Types and number of activities delivered, including coordination activities (PW) 2. Number of women supported to take on leadership roles at the local, district, provincial and national level (PW; MTDP III 3.5.2)
Project Outcome 4: Women are promoted as leaders in gender sensitive political institutions. Output 4.1: Work with Political Parties (PPs) and the Integrity of Political Parties and Candidates Commission (IPPCC) to build commitment of PPs to gender equality and Women's Leadership.
Indicator: Types and number of activities delivered (PW)
Output 4.2 Work with National Parliament to promote Women in Leadership and gender equality. Indicator: 1. Types and number of activities delivered (PW) 2. Evidence of gender responsive laws and policies (PW; MTDP III KRA 3.5)
Output 4.3 Build capacity of Department for Community Development and Religion (DfCDR) to lead this agenda from the Government of Papua New Guinea's (GoPNGs) perspective. Indicator: 1. Types and number of activities delivered (PW) 2. Evidence of strategies to promote women's participation at all levels of government (MTDP III 3.5 Sector Strategy 5)

comment.narrative:
Project Outcome 1: Legal and policy frameworks and arrangements promote gender balance in political decision-making bodies
Output 1.1 Technical assistance provided to Government of Papua New Guinea institutions as required to strengthen women's political leadership, especially at national level.
Baseline:5 MPs attend Pacific Regional MPs’ workshop on gender equality and women’s empowerment, 2018 and 2019
Project Outcome 2: A cadre of interested, diverse and capable women political leaders is formed at national and sub-national levels.
Output 2.1 Action research undertaken to track progress for women over time in the target provinces.
Baseline: # of women in leadership positions in PacWIP website update 2012
Project Outcome 4: Women are promoted as leaders in gender sensitive political institutions. Output 4.1: Work with Political Parties (PPs) and the Integrity of Political Parties and Candidates Commission (IPPCC) to build commitment of PPs to gender equality and Women's Leadership.
Baseline: Gender mainstreaming workshop with MPs and political parties, 2018 and 2019
Output 4.2 Work with National Parliament to promote Women in Leadership and gender equality.
Baseline: 1. Gender awareness and sensitization meetings and conferences for MPs between 2012 to 2019. 2. 0
Output 4.3 Build capacity of Department for Community Development and Religion (DfCDR) to lead this agenda from the Government of Papua New Guinea's (GoPNGs) perspective.
Baseline: 1. Capacity Development assessment of DfCDR, ODW and NCW, 2010 2. Gender mainstreaming workshop with MPs and political parties and women leaders in 2018 and 2019

Project Outcome 1: Legal and policy frameworks and arrangements promote gender balance in political decision-making bodies Output 1.1 Technical assistance provided to Government of Papua New Guinea institutions as required to strengthen womens political leadership, especially at national level. Target: 1 national event per year to WIL and gender awareness for parties
Project Outcome 2: A cadre of interested, diverse and capable women political leaders is formed at national and sub-national levels. Output 2.1 Action research undertaken to track progress for women over time in the target provinces. Target: Website updated profiling women in leadership positions based on the electoral cycle for national and provincial elections including Bougainville and Motu Koita Assembly.
Project Outcome 4: Women are promoted as leaders in gender sensitive political institutions. Output 4.1: Work with Political Parties (PPs) and the Integrity of Political Parties and Candidates Commission (IPPCC) to build commitment of PPs to gender equality and Womens Leadership.
Target: Parties members with capacity to engage and advocate for 20% for women in the political parties and in the Organic Law on Integrity of Political Parties and Candidates
Output 4.2 Work with National Parliament to promote Women in Leadership and gender equality. Targets: 1. 1 National event per year to promote gender equality issues and dialogue 2. Set up of gender research unit or support services for MPs.
Output 4.3 Build capacity of Department for Community Development and Religion (DfCDR) to lead this agenda from the Government of Papua New Guineas (GoPNGs) perspective. Targets: 1. Updated assessment of ODW 2. Finalisation of the Organic Law on Integrity of Political Parties and Candidates Commission with inclusion of 20% quotas for women

Outcome 1.1 Target: 1 national event per year to WIL and gender awareness for parties Results: None but 5 provincial workshops were conducted in Milne Bay. Jiwaka, East Sepik, Mt Hagen and West New Britain
Outcome 2.1 Target: Website updated profiling women in leadership positions based on the electoral cycle for national and provincial elections including Bougainville and Motu Koita Assembly. Results: An online Registration Form was developed for women to register their interest in contending 2022 general elections. IPCCC will then use the information derived from the registration form to use as the database for planning their future interventions. So far 77 women have been registered.
Outcome 4.1 Target: Parties members with capacity to engage and advocate for 20% for women in the political parties and in the Organic Law on Integrity of Political Parties and Candidates Result: None
Outcome 4.2 Targets: 1. 1 National event per year to promote gender equality issues and dialogue Result: None 2. Set up of gender research unit or support services for MPs. Result: None
Outcome 4.3 Target: 1. Updated assessment of ODW Result: None 2. Finalisation of the Organic Law on Integrity of Political Parties and Candidates Commission with inclusion of 20% quotas for women Result: None

Target: 1 national event per year to WIL and gender awareness for parties
Project Outcome 2: A cadre of interested, diverse and capable women political leaders is formed at national and sub-national levels. Output 2.1 Action research undertaken to track progress for women over time in the target provinces. Target: Website updated profiling women in leadership positions based on the electoral cycle for national and provincial elections including Bougainville and Motu Koita Assembly.
Project Outcome 4: Women are promoted as leaders in gender sensitive political institutions. Output 4.1: Work with Political Parties (PPs) and the Integrity of Political Parties and Candidates Commission (IPPCC) to build commitment of PPs to gender equality and Womens Leadership.
Target: Parties members with capacity to engage and advocate for 20% for women in the political parties and in the Organic Law on Integrity of Political Parties and Candidates
Output 4.2 Work with National Parliament to promote Women in Leadership and gender equality. Targets: 1. 1 National event per year to promote gender equality issues and dialogue 2. Set up of gender research unit or support services for MPs.
Output 4.3 Build capacity of Department for Community Development and Religion (DfCDR) to lead this agenda from the Government of Papua New Guineas (GoPNGs) perspective. Targets: 1. Updated assessment of ODW 2. Finalisation of the Organic Law on Integrity of Political Parties and Candidates Commission with inclusion of 20% quotas for women

Project Outcome 1: Legal and policy frameworks and arrangements promote gender balance in political decision-making bodies Output 1.1 Technical assistance provided to Government of Papua New Guinea institutions as required to strengthen womens political leadership, especially at national level. Target: 1 national event per year to WIL and gender awareness for parties Results: UNDP in September 2021 supported IPPCC in the hosting of two regional workshops for Southern and Momase regions. The aim of the workshops was providing technical assistance and support to the Government of Papua New Guinea institutions as required to strengthen womens political leadership, especially at national level. Political party members were also invited as speakers and representatives.
Project Outcome 2: A cadre of interested, diverse and capable women political leaders is formed at national and sub-national levels. Output 2.1 Action research undertaken to track progress for women over time in the target provinces. Target: Website updated profiling women in leadership positions based on the electoral cycle for national and provincial elections including Bougainville and Motu Koita Assembly. Results: Work in progress
Project Outcome 4: Women are promoted as leaders in gender sensitive political institutions. Output 4.1: Work with Political Parties (PPs) and the Integrity of Political Parties and Candidates Commission (IPPCC) to build commitment of PPs to gender equality and Womens Leadership. Target: Parties members with capacity to engage and advocate for 20% for women in the political parties and in the Organic Law on Integrity of Political Parties and Candidates Results: Work in progress
Output 4.2 Work with National Parliament to promote Women in Leadership and gender equality. Targets: 1. 1 National event per year to promote gender equality issues and dialogue Results: Work in progress Targets: 2. Set up of gender research unit or support services for MPs. Results: Work in progress
Output 4.3 Build capacity of Department for Community Development and Religion (DfCDR) to lead this agenda from the Government of Papua New Guineas (GoPNGs) perspective. Targets: 1. Updated assessment of ODW Results: Work in progress Targets: 2. Finalization of the Organic Law on Integrity of Political Parties and Candidates Commission with inclusion of 20% quotas for women Results: Work in progress

Project Outcome 1: Legal and policy frameworks and arrangements promote gender balance in political decision-making bodies Output 1.1 Technical assistance provided to Government of Papua New Guinea institutions as required to strengthen womens political leadership, especially at national level. Target: 1 national event per year to WIL and gender awareness for parties
Project Outcome 2: A cadre of interested, diverse and capable women political leaders is formed at national and sub-national levels. Output 2.1 Action research undertaken to track progress for women over time in the target provinces. Target: Website updated profiling women in leadership positions based on the electoral cycle for national and provincial elections including Bougainville and Motu Koita Assembly.
Project Outcome 4: Women are promoted as leaders in gender sensitive political institutions. Output 4.1: Work with Political Parties (PPs) and the Integrity of Political Parties and Candidates Commission (IPPCC) to build commitment of PPs to gender equality and Womens Leadership.
Target: Parties members with capacity to engage and advocate for 20% for women in the political parties and in the Organic Law on Integrity of Political Parties and Candidates
Output 4.2 Work with National Parliament to promote Women in Leadership and gender equality. Targets: 1. 1 National event per year to promote gender equality issues and dialogue 2. Set up of gender research unit or support services for MPs.
Output 4.3 Build capacity of Department for Community Development and Religion (DfCDR) to lead this agenda from the Government of Papua New Guineas (GoPNGs) perspective. Targets: 1. Updated assessment of ODW 2. Finalisation of the Organic Law on Integrity of Political Parties and Candidates Commission with inclusion of 20% quotas for women
